title: Tsongkhapa
description: A painting of Tsongkapa, founder of the Geluk tradition, with the two principal students, Gyaltsab on the left and Khedrub on the right.

title: Mahakala - Panjarnata
description: Pañjarnata Mahākāla is the protector of the Hevajra cycle of Tantras. The iconography and rituals are found in the eighteenth chapter of the Vajra Pañjara ("canopy," or "pavilion") Tantra, an exclusive 'explanatory tantra' to Hevajra itself. It is dated to the late fourteenth or early fifteenth century.

title: Mahakala - Panjarnata
description: Mahākāla surrounded by the stylized flames of pristine awareness and emanating forth from the licks of flame are messengers in the shapes of various animals, black crows, black dogs, wolves, black men and women.

title: Sachen Kunga Nyingpo
description: A painting of Sachen Kunga Nyingpo.

title: Ngorchen Kunga Zangpo
description: Ngorchen Kunga Zangpo, the founder of the Ngor Branch of the Sakya tradition.
location: Collection of Shelley and Donald Rubin
source_original: Collection of Shelley and Donald Rubin

title: Ngorchen Kunga Zangpo
description: Ngorchen Kunga Zangpo at the left and his successor Muchen Sempa Chenpo Konchok Gyaltsen sitting on the right, surrounded by lineage teachers.

title: Buddhashri
description: Buddhashri surrounded by the lineage teachers of the Yogachara tradition of Buddhist philosophy. He was the principal teacher of Ngorchen Kunga Zangpo, the founder of the Ngor branch of the Sakya tradition.

title: Lhachok Sengge
description: An ivory statue of Lhachok Sengge. The inscription on the base of the statue reads "rgyal ba lha mchog seng ge."

title: Damarupa
description: Damarupa and Avadhutipa, two Indian siddhas. On the left is the siddha Damarupa holding upraised in his right hand a damaru drum and a skullcup in the left. On the viewer's right is Avadhutipa holding a skullcup to the heart with the left hand and pointing downwards with the right hand.
location: Collection of Shelley and Donald Rubin
source_original: Collection of Shelley and Donald Rubin

title: Sanggye Sengge
description: Sanggye Sengge, the eleventh throne holder of Ngor Ewam Monastery.

title: Two Lineal Lamas
description: Two men, Kunkhyen and Jamyang Chokyi Gyalpo. This painting is from a set of compositions that appears based on similar paintings identified as a Sakya Lamdre lineage set. The secondary lineage that starts at the top left and proceeds down the right and left registers is possibly the Prajñāparamitā ineage beginning with Śākyamuni Buddha.

title: Sangye Sengge
description: Sanggye Sengge, the eleventh throne holder of Ngor Ewam Monastery is the main figure in this work, created between 1550 and 1560. It is in the Menri style with Beri elements.

title: Jetsun Drakpa Gyaltsen
description: Drakpa Gyaltsen and Sakya Pandita, uncle and nephew, teacher and student surrounded by the lineage kings of Shambhala. This composition belongs to a larger set of paintings depicting the Lamdre lineage of the Sakya tradition of Tibetan Buddhism in a two figure per composition configuration.

title: Shangton Chobar
description: Shangton Chobar with Sachen Kunga Nyingpo on the middle left, Sonam Tsemo on the right.

title: Sakya Pandita Kunga Gyaltsen
description: A Sakya lineage painting.

title: Tsongkhapa
description: Tsongkhapa, founder of the Geluk tradition, with the two principal students, Gyaltsab on the left and Khedrubje on the right.

title: Six Kagyu Teachers With Lineage
description: An important early Kagyu painting, possibly the earliest known depiction of the First Karmapa. The lineage depicted is likely the Shri Saraha Hevajra that passed into Tibet through Zhang Yudrakpa.

title: Karma Pakshi with lineage
description: A thirteenth-century portrait of the Second Karmapa, Karma Pakshi.

title: Taklung Tangpa Tashi Pel with lineage
description: A portrait of Taklung Tangpa Tashi Pel with the basic Kagyu lineage, dating to the thirteenth century.

title: Early Karmapa with footprints
description: The footprints of an early Karmapa, probably the first, Dusum Khyenpa, together with a portrait and the eight auspicious symbols.

title: Cakrasamvara with the footprints of Drigungpa Rinchen Pel
description: Cakrasaṃvara, Sahaja Heruka, with the footprints of Drigungpa Rinchen Pel.

title: Pakmodrupa Dorje Gyelpo
description: Pakmodrupa Dorje Gyelpo. One of the three principal students of Gampopa and teacher to many patriarchs of Kagyu sub-traditions.

title: Padampa Sanggye
description: An early statue of the twelfth-century adept Padampa Sanggye

title: Sakya Lotsawa with his teachers
description: Sakya Lotsawa Jampai Dorje, the Twenty-Third Sakya Tridzin.

title: Karma Kagyu Refuge Field
description: Karma Kagyu Field of Accumulation painting with the Fifteenth Karmapa, Kakyab Dorje, as the last lineage holder at the time of the compositions creation.

title: Tsongkhapa
description: A very early -- possibly the earliest known -- portrait of Tsongkhapa narrating his life story.

title: Gampopa together with early Drukpa Kagyu masters
description: A magnificent eighteenth-century painting depicting Gampopa with a number of early Drukpa Kagyu masters, including early abbots of Ralung Monastery and several of the "Nine Incomparable Lions."

title: The Seventh Dalai Lama with previous incarnations
description: The Seventh Dalai Lama, Kelzang Gyatso, along with a selection of the previous incarnations according to the Book of Kadam.

title: Pakmodrupa
description: Pakmodrupa Dorje Gyelpo, one of the three principal students of Gampopa.

title: Padmasambhava
description: The style of this painting is known as tseltang, a red background with fine gold lines forming the shapes of the subject deities. Only the eyes are filled with white and black pigments.

title: Padmasambhava
description: An early image of Padmasambhava with Nyangrel Nyima Wozer and masters of various traditions, including Padampa Sanggye.
location: Collection of Shelley and Donald Rubin
source_original: Collection of Shelley and Donald Rubin

title: Namkha Pelzang and a Naro Chodruk lineage
description: This eighteenth-century painting of Namkha Pelzang, the twelfth abbot of Ralung Monastery, belongs to a set of Ralung patriarchs. Two other paintings belonging to the set can be seen on Himalayan Art Resources.

title: Gampopa and Karmapa
description: This sixteenth-century painting depicts two founding patriarchs of the Karma Kagyu school, Gampopa Sonam Rinchen and Dusum Khyenpa, later known as the First Karmapa.

title: Wangdu Nyingpo and other masters
description: Wangdu Nyinpo was the Twenty-Ninth Sakya Tridzin. This painting gives visual representation to his previous incarnations, which include Padmasambhava, and some of his disciples.

title: Jikten Gonpo with the First Chungtsang and the Second Chetsang
description: This sixteenth-century painting shows the Drigung founder, Jikten Gonpo, with two men who stood at the beginning of the two main incarnation lines at monastery, the Drigung Chetsang and the Drigung Chungtsang.

title: Portrait of Drenpa Namkha
description: Nineteenth-century portrait of the Bon master Drenpa Namkha surrounded by deities and lineage masters.

title: Drukpa Kagyu Lineage of Bhutan
description: Nineteenth-century painting of the Drukpa Kagyu lineage of Bhutan.

title: Drukpa Kagyu and Kagyu Lineages
description: Eighteenth-century thangka of Drukpa Kagyu and Kagyu lineage masters.

title: Episodes from the Life of Milarepa
description: This nineteenth-century painting of Milarepa is possibly a copy of an original from Pelpung Monastery. A representative of the Situ style, it exemplifies the types of paintings commissioned by Situ Paṇchen and his circle.

title: Third Pawo Tsuklak Gyatso
description: An exceptional painting of the Third Nenang Pawo surrounded by hierarchs of the Karma Kagyu and other traditions. The size of the hand and footprints suggest that they are stylized rather than actual prints.

title: Śākyaśrībhadra
description: An eighteenth-century painting of the Indian master Śākyaśrībhadra.
location: Collection of Shelley and Donald Rubin
source_original: Collection of Shelley and Donald Rubin

title: Tibetan Trade Delegation to the US and UK, 1948
description: The Tibetan Trade Delegation to the US and the UK stand outside 10 Downing Street with Prime Minister Clement Atlee. The photo shows, from left to right, Khenchung Tubten Tsepel Taikhang (younger brother of Shakabpa), Finance Minister Wangchuk Deden Shakabpa, Yampel Pangdatsang, Prime Minister Clement Atlee, Surkhang Lhawang Topgyal and Kaludharma Ratna (interpreter). An Advanced Political History of Tibet misidentifies Surkhang Lhawang Topgyal as his father Dzasa Surkhang Surpa Wangchen Tseten, but in fact it was Surkhang Lhawang Topgyal who was part of the trade delegation as its interpreter.
source: Shakabpa, Wangchuk Deden. 2010. One Hundred Thousand Moons: An Advanced Political History of Tibet. Translated by Derek Maher. Netherlands: Brill.
source_original: Shakabpa, Wangchuk Deden. 2010. One Hundred Thousand Moons: An Advanced Political History of Tibet. Translated by Derek Maher. Netherlands: Brill.

title: Padmasambhava
description: This eighteenth-century painting features Padmasambhava surrounded by his consorts Yeshe Tsogyel and Mandarava. Below are Śāntarakṣita; and Trisong Detsen.

title: The Demoness of Tibet
description: The Demoness of Tibet is a close copy of a well-known image located in the Tibet Museum in Lhasa. The landscape of Tibet is shown as the mythical demoness of Tibetan legend. Important Buddhist temples and monasteries are located across her body, spanning from the Ngari region in the west to Kham in the east.

title: Khenpo Jigme Puntsok with Khandro Tāre Lama and Namtrul Jigme Puntsok
description: Prolific treasure revealers Namtrul Jigme Phuntsok and Khandro Tāre Lhamo are pictured beside Khenpo Jigme Puntsok, who gave them teachings and also authorized them as treasure revealers.
image_name: Terton Couple with Khenpo Jigme Phuntsok.jpg
thumb_name: Terton Couple with Khenpo Jigme Phuntsok_thumb.jpg

title: The First Dorje Drak Rigdzin
description: A nineteenth-century painting featuring the First Dorje Drak Rigdzin, Rigdzin Godemchen Ngodrub Gyeltsen, a Nyingma treasure revealer who discovered the Jangter, or Northern Treasures.

title: Puchungwa Zhonnu Gyelsten
description: An eighteenth-century painting of Puchungwa Zhonnu Gyeltsen with Rinchen Zangpo.

title: Padmasambhava with Drigung Kagyu Refuge Field
description: This late eighteenth- or early twentieth-century Drigung Kagyu painting of Padmasambhava and the Drigung Kagyu refuge field is associated with a treasure tradition of Rinchen Puntsok. Drigung Monastery is pictured along the bottom of the painting along with Terdrom on the left edge. A nearby treasure site is shown adjacent to Terdrom.

title: Surkhang Wangchen Tseten and Lhagyari Tseten Chodzom
description: Surkhang Wangchen Tseten and his first wife Lhagyari Tseten Chodzom, circa 1926.
source: Yuthok, Dorje Yudon. 1995. House of the Turquoise Roof. United Kingdom: Shambhala.
source_original: Yuthok, Dorje Yudon. 1995. House of the Turquoise Roof. United Kingdom: Shambhala.

title: Yuthok Dorje Yudon
description: Yuthok Dorje Yudon, second from right, with her relatives, ca. 1937, was a member of two prominent Lhasa families, the Surkhangs and the Yuthoks.
source: Yuthok, Dorje Yudon. 1995. House of the Turquoise Roof. United Kingdom: Shambhala.
source_original: Yuthok, Dorje Yudon. 1995. House of the Turquoise Roof. United Kingdom: Shambhala.

title: Lhagyari Namgyel Gyatso
description: Lhagyari Namgyel Gyatso, the Seventeenth Ruler of Eyul and the head of the aristocratic Lhagyari family, in his later years in exile in India.

title: Lhagyari Namgyel Gyatso and Lhagyari Puntsok Drolkar
description: A wedding picture of Lhagyari Namgyel Gyatso, the Seventeenth Ruler of Eyul, with his second wife Puntsok Drolkar, in India. In 1985.

title: Yuthok Dorje Yudon
description: A photograph of Yuthok Dorje Yudon, a member of the Surkhang family who married into the Yuthoks, in 1988, taken by Christine Cox.
source: Yuthok, Dorje Yudon. 1995. House of the Turquoise Roof. United Kingdom: Shambhala.
source_original: Yuthok, Dorje Yudon. 1995. House of the Turquoise Roof. United Kingdom: Shambhala.

title: Surkhang Wangchen Gelek
description: Surkhang Wangchen Gelek, who became a Kalon of the Tibetan government at the age of thirty-three.
source: The Tibet Album. "Wangchen Geleg Surkhang, Phuntsog Rabgye Ragashar" 05 Dec. 2006. The Pitt Rivers Museum.
source_original: The Tibet Album. "Wangchen Geleg Surkhang, Phuntsog Rabgye Ragashar" 05 Dec. 2006. The Pitt Rivers Museum.

title: Surkhang Wangchen Gelek
description: Surkhang Wangchen Gelek is pictured with the Fourteenth Dalai Lama to the right.

title: Yuthok Tashi Dhondup and Kunpel
description: Yuthok Tashi Dhondup with Kunpel, a favorite of the Thirteenth Dalai Lama, with the Dalai Lama's Baby Austin with the license plate "Tibet 2." The photo was taken in 1933 in front of the British mission at Dekyilingka in Lhasa.

title: Yuthok Tashi Dhondup and Taring Jigme
description: Yuthok Tashi Dhondup and Taring Jigme, generals in the Tibetan army, circa 1931. Yuthok was Depon or general of the Drongdrak garrison at the time.
source: Yuthok, Dorje Yudon. 1995. House of the Turquoise Roof. United Kingdom: Shambhala.
source_original: Yuthok, Dorje Yudon. 1995. House of the Turquoise Roof. United Kingdom: Shambhala.

title: A sculpture of Lowo Khenchen
description: A cast bronze sculpture of the sixteenth-century Ngor master Lowo Khenchen Sonam Lhundrub.

title: The Potala Palace and the Main Monuments of Lhasa
description: This painting shows major sites of Lhasa including the Jokhang, Potala Palace and Lukhang. The monasteries of Sera, Drepung, and Sangpu Neutok are also pictured. It is possible that the image depicts activities during Losar festivities.

title: Scenes from the Life of the Fifth Dalai Lama (1617-1682)
description: An eighteenth-century painting of The Fifth Dalai Lama pictured with major scenes from his life.
image_name: 62 Rubin Dalai Lama C2003.9.2 image only.jpg
thumb_name: 62 Rubin Dalai Lama C2003.9.2 image only_thumb.jpg

title: Perspective Drawing of Lhasa
description: This drawing shows Lhasa before 1950 from an elevated perspective. The highly detailed representation shows many major monasteries and landmarks of Lhasa.
source: Larsen, Knud and Sinding-Larsen, Amund. 2001. The Lhasa Atlas: Traditional Tibetan Architecture and Townscape. Kiribati: Serindia.
source_original: Larsen, Knud and Sinding-Larsen, Amund. 2001. The Lhasa Atlas: Traditional Tibetan Architecture and Townscape. Kiribati: Serindia.

title: Rinchen Sadutshang with Taklha Phuntsok Tashi
description: Rinchen Sadutshang, a fifth rank official at the Tibetan foreign ministry, with his colleague Takla Phuntsok Tashi, a brother in law of the Fourteenth Dalai Lama, in front of the Potala in 1952. Sadutshang would later become a Kalon in India in 1978 and would become the Representative at the Bureau of the Dalai Lama in Delhi, his last post before retirement.
source: A Life Unforeseen: A Memoir of Service to Tibet by Rinchen Sadutshang
source_original: A Life Unforeseen: A Memoir of Service to Tibet by Rinchen Sadutshang

title: Lo Gendun Sadutshang with Khampas, 1951
description: Lo Gendun Sadutshang with Khampas he had gathered as armed guards to escort the young Fourteenth Dalai Lama, who had just assumed full political power, from the capital Lhasa to Yatung by the border for safety, in December 1951.
source: A Life Unforeseen: A Memoir of Service to Tibet by Rinchen Sadutshang
source_original: A Life Unforeseen: A Memoir of Service to Tibet by Rinchen Sadutshang

title: Tibetan Delegation to the United Nations
description: Tibetan government officials Rinchen Sadutshang, Tsipon Wangchuk Deden Shakabpa and Gyalo Thondup, the Dalai Lama's older brother, in front of the United Nations in September 1959. The delegation made three such trips to the UN, in the falls of 1959, 1960 and 1961, to seek support for Tibet.
source: A Life Unforeseen: A Memoir of Service to Tibet by Rinchen Sadutshang
source_original: A Life Unforeseen: A Memoir of Service to Tibet by Rinchen Sadutshang

title: Khedrubje Gelek Pelzang
description: To the left, Khedrupje is depicted while thinking of his great teacher, Tsongkhapa, who appears above him on a cloud. On the middle right, Khedrubje is making an offering to Tsongkhapa. On the lower right, Khedrubje is seated while editing a manuscript.
location: Collection of Shelley and Donald Rubin
source: Collection of Shelley and Donald Rubin
source_original: Collection of Shelley and Donald Rubin

title: Third Karmapa and Lineage Masters
description: A unique image made with ink shows Buddhist masters from multiple traditions. The style is considered unusual and has been associated with the Tenth Karmapa.

title: Milarepa
description: An eighteenth-century scuplture of Milarepa from Tibet, carved of stone.

title: The Eighth Tatsak
description: A nineteenth-century painting from Tibet of the Eighth Tatsak with prominent Geluk figures.

title: Surkhang Wangchen Gelek with Dekyi Lhaze
description: Surkhang Wangchen Gelek with wife Dekyi Lhaze and daughter in Lhasa city with the Potala Palace in the background. The photo was taken by Heinrich Harrer.
source: Yuthok, Dorje Yudon. 1995. House of the Turquoise Roof. United Kingdom: Shambhala.
source_original: Yuthok, Dorje Yudon. 1995. House of the Turquoise Roof. United Kingdom: Shambhala.

title: Rigdzin Kunzang Sherab
description: An eighteenth-century painting of Rigdzin Kunzang Sherab, the founder of Pelyul monastery, surrounded by deities and Nyingma masters.

title: Shakyamuni Buddha
description: The central figure of Shakyamuni Buddha is shown with Tsongkhapa and primary disciples in the upper left corner. Below are protector deities.

title: Machik Labdron
description: This nineteenth-century painting depicts Machik Labdron with tantric deities and mahasiddhas.

title: Padmasambhava with Jigme Lingpa and Disciples
description: This eighteenth-century painting depicts Padmasambhava as a monk surrounded by several disciples and Jigme Lingpa above his head.

title: Mahakala with Four Hands
description: The central figure of Mahakala is depicted with historical figures including Nāgārjuna and Ga Lotsāwa, as well as masters of the Drukpa Kagyu lineage.

title: Three Sisters
description: The Three Sisters were Indian deities brought into the Tibetan pantheon initially in the eleventh century by the Sakya translator Bari Lotsawa Rinchen Drak and later through treasure revelation.
location: Collection of Shelley and Donald Rubin
source_original: Collection of Shelley and Donald Rubin

title: Group of Tibetan Army Officers
description: A group of Tibetan army officers with Tsarong Dasang Damdul seated in the center. The photo was likely taken in Lhasa. Tsarong, a commoner who rose to become commander-in-chief, created the first modern Tibetan army.
source: Taring, Rinchen Dolma. 1986. Daughter of Tibet. United Kingdom: Wisdom Publications.
source_original: Taring, Rinchen Dolma. 1986. Daughter of Tibet. United Kingdom: Wisdom Publications.

title: Taring Women
description: Taring Rinchen Dolma with her mother-in-law Rani Taring and her sister-in-law Kalden Wangmo. Raja Taring, Tsodrak Namgyal, of Sikkim, fled to Tibet in 1892 when the British Army entered Gangtok. He remained in Tibet, living at Taring estate near Gyantse, and later abdicating the Sikkim throne. His sons entered Tibetan government service.
source: Taring, Rinchen Dolma. 1986. Daughter of Tibet. United Kingdom: Wisdom Publications.
source_original: Taring, Rinchen Dolma. 1986. Daughter of Tibet. United Kingdom: Wisdom Publications.

title: Go Lotsawa Khukpa Lhetse
description: The important translator Go Khukpa Lhetse is the central figure of this nineteenth-century painting, with Atiśa depicted above.

title: Do Khyentse Yeshe Dorje
description: This nineteenth-century painting depicts the central figure of Do Khyentse Yeshe Dorje with previous Nyingma masters above.

title: Śākyamuni Buddha with Geluk Masters
description: This eighteenth-century painting depicts Śākyamuni Buddha with primordial buddha Vajradhara, bodhisattvas Maitreya and Mañjuśrī, and multiple Geluk masters.

title: Pema Karpo
description: This nineteenth-century painting from Bhutan shows Pema Karpo surrounded by deities and Buddhist masters Marpa, Milarepa, and Marpa. The primordial buddha Vajradhara is pictured above the central figure.

title: Sachen Kunga Nyingpo
description: A fifteenth-century painting of Sachen Kunga Nyingpo, the Third Sakya Trizin and son of Khon Konchok Gyelpo.

title: Avalokiteśvara Jinasagara with Kagyu Masters
description: Avalokiteśvara Jinasagara is depicted at center with meditation deities immediately surrounding: Hayagrīva (left), Guhyajñāna (right), Siddharajni (center top), Mahākāla (center bottom). On the uppermost level is Milarepa on the left, Marpa in the center, and Gampopa on the right.

title: Padmasambhava as Pema Jungne
description: A nineteenth-century painting of Padmasambhava as Pema Jungne depicts his disciple Sokpo Pelgyi Yeshe in the lower left corner.

title: Padmasambhava as Sengge Dradok
description: This Nyingma painting of Padmasambhava as Sengge Dradok shows Yeshe Tsogyel in the lower right corner.

title: Jatson Nyingpo
description: Nineteenth-century painting of Jatson Nyingpo from eastern Tibet depicts the prolific treasure revealer wearing monks robes.

title: Machik Labdron
description: Nineteenth-century painting of Machik Labdron as a wisdom dakini.

title: Machik Labdron and Chod Refuge Field
description: Mid-twentieth-century painting of Machik Labdron and the Chod refuge field displaying teachers and deities.

title: Padmasambhava - Guru Drakpo
description: This twentieth-century painting depicts Padmasambhava in wrathful form as Guru Drakpo, in the treasure tradition of Padmasambhava biographer Nyangrel Nyima Wozer.

title: Namkhai Nyingpo
description: Namkhai Nyingpo, one of the twenty-five disciples of Padmasambhava, is depicted with long-life ritual implements. Other details of this nineteenth-century painting from Kham suggest a elements from Jamgon Kongtrul's story of Namkhai Nyingpo and Dorje Tso.

title: Avalokiteśvara
description: Ivory sculpture of Avalokiteśvara attributed to the Tenth Karmapa, Choying Dorje, dated to 1647/1648 or 1658.

title: Pehar Gyelpo
description: The protector deity Pehar Gyelpo is depicted with three Geluk masters above.

title: Bodhisattva with Atisa and Dromton
description: This eighteenth-century painting of a bodhisattva depicts Atiśa and Kadam founder Dromton on the top (left and right). Tara and Jambala are pictured along the bottom. Dromton is considered an emanation of Padmapani Avalokiteśvara, who is the central figure in this image according to some sources. However, the presence of a sword and book suggests that the central figure is Mañjuśrī.

title: Atiśa
description: This painting of Atiśa is from the early to mid twelfth century and features extensive inscriptions on the reverse side.

title: Preaching Śākyamuni
description: This prayer card dating to around the year 1000 is from Toling in Western Tibet. It depicts Śākyamuni Buddha in a preaching posture.

title: Lhalungpas in Delhi
description: This undated photograph (collection of Samphe Lhalungpa) shows Jigme Rigden Lhalungpa, Lobsang Phuntsok Lhalungpa, Sogyal Rinpoche, Diki Lhalungpa, E. Gene Smith and Harold Talbott.

title: Letter from Tibetan Exile Government to Lobsang Phuntsok Lhalungpa
description: This letter from the Tibetan Government in Exile documents Lobsang Phuntsok Lhalungpa's role in cultural preservation activities of the early exile government.

title: Letter from St. Joseph's College to Lobsang Phuntsok Lhalungpa
description: A letter certifying Lobsang Phunstok Lhalungpa's employment and exemplary service as a teacher at St. Joseph's College in Darjeeling.

title: Receipt from Lobsang P. Lhalungpa to Sakya Trizin
description: A receipt dated September 9, 1965 documenting the dispersal of funds to the Sakya Trizin and the Sakya Settlement at Dehra Dun, by Lobsang P. Lhalungpa on behalf of the Tibet Society of United Kingdom.

title: Receipt from Lobsang P. Lhalungpa to Tibetan Bonpo Foundation
description: A receipt dated from 1965 documenting the dispersal of funds to the Tibet Bonpo Foundation by Lobsang P. Lhalungpa on behalf of the Tibet Society of United Kingdom. The Tibet Bonpo Foundation was registered at the Lhalungpa residence in Delhi.

title: Vajrakila
description: This eighteenth-century painting of Vajrakila depicts Sakya masters on either side of Vajrasattva.
source: Tucci, Giuseppe. 1980. Tibetan Painted Scrolls. Japan: Rinsen Book.
source_original: Tucci, Giuseppe. 1980. Tibetan Painted Scrolls. Japan: Rinsen Book.

title: Avalokiteśvara
description: This sixteenth-century thangka of Avalokiteśvara depicts the Tsembu teaching lineage, named for Tsembupa, one of the five great systems of Avalokiteśvara practice in Tibet. This system is well preserved in Geluk and Sakya traditions.
source: Trungpa, Chögyam. 1975. Visual Dharma: The Buddhist Art of Tibet. United Kingdom: Shambhala Publications.
source_original: Trungpa, Chögyam. 1975. Visual Dharma: The Buddhist Art of Tibet. United Kingdom: Shambhala Publications.

title: Gyelrong Gyelpo, Tseten Zhabdrung, Meu Gyelpo
description: Gyelrong Choktse Gyelpo, Tseten Zhabdrung and Meu Gyalpo photographed at the White Stupa in Beijing.

title: Resistance fighters at Kalsang Phug
description: Tibetan resistance fighters at Kalsang Phug HQ in 1966.

title: Officials at Hastings House
description: Officials at Hastings House in Calcutta, 1910.

title: Panchen Lama and Bakula Rinpoche
description: Panchen Lama and Bakula Rinpoche photograped in Kathmandu, Nepal, 1986.

title: Tsarong Dasang Damdul and Tsarong Pema Dolkar
description: Dasang Damdul Tsarong and his wife Pema Dolkar during Losar, 1937.
source: The Tibet Album. "Tsarong and Pema Dolkar at home at New Year" 05 Dec. 2006. The Pitt Rivers Museum.
source_original: The Tibet Album. "Tsarong and Pema Dolkar at home at New Year" 05 Dec. 2006. The Pitt Rivers Museum.

title: Derge King Dorje Sengge with family
description: Members of the Royal Family of Derge led by Dorje Sengge
source: Shelton, AL. 1921. "Life Among the People of Eastern Tibet. National Geographic, vol. 40, no. 3, pp. 294-326.
source_original: Shelton, AL. 1921. "Life Among the People of Eastern Tibet. National Geographic, vol. 40, no. 3, pp. 294-326.

title: Sixteenth Karmapa Rangjung Rigpai Dorje
description: This twentieth-century painting of the Sixteenth Karmapa depicts Shakyamuni Buddha in the upper register and Kagyu masters below.

title: Panchen Lama Lobzang Chokyi Gyeltsen
description: Lobzang Chokyi Gyeltsen, the first person to hold the title of Paṇchen Lama, is pictured in this eighteenth-century painting, with Maitreya to the right enveloped in a rainbow. The upper left depicts Cakrasaṃvara and to the right is Paṇchen Lama's teacher Khedrub Sanggye Yeshe. The lower left shows Vaiśravaṇa, with Begtse Chen to the right.

title: Tseten Zhabdrung and Sungrab Gyatso
description: An unidentified person, Tseten Zhabdrung, Sungrab Gyatso (left to right)

title: Lama Gyurdrak, LP Lhalungpa, Canadian Commissioner and Family
description: Lobsang Phuntsok Lhalungpa photographed with Canadian High Commisioner James George and family, Delhi, late 1960's.

title: Barawa Kagyu Refuge Field
description: This nineteenth-century painting (likely made after 1829) from Drumpa Monastery in southern Tibet near the border of Bhutan depicts the Mountain Dharma Trilogy transmission of Yanggonpa. The painting portrays Kagyu masters including lineages of the Barawa subsect of the Drukpa Kagyu. Annotations and analysis courtesy of Dr. Marlene Erschbamer.
source: Visual Dharma: The Buddhist Art of Tibet by Chogyam Trungpa. United Kingdom: Shambhala, 1975.
source_original: Visual Dharma: The Buddhist Art of Tibet by Chogyam Trungpa. United Kingdom: Shambhala, 1975.

title: Avalokiteśvara Sāhasrabhujalokeśvara
description: Avalokiteśvara with one thousand hands and eleven faces in the nyungne tradition of Gelongma Pelmo with Geluk lineage teachers of Tashilhunpo Monastery.

title: Tibetan Primer
description: 1962 Tibetan Primer written by Lobsang Phuntsok Lhalungpa on behalf of the Fourteenth Dalai Lama in collaboration with Khendrung Tubten Norzang, Dzeme Rinpoche, Dudjom Rinpoche, Thartse Khen Rinpoche, Rato Kyongla Rinpoche, and published by Kundeling Woser Gyeltsen.

title: Dudjom Rinpoche with lamas in Kalimpong
description: Dudjom Rinpoche with lamas in Kalimpong

title: Rahula and Retinue
description: Rahula, wrathful protector of the the treasure tradition, is depicted with various masters in a nineteenth-century painting from Kham.
